intro: Ilex nuculicava var. auctumnalis, commonly known as the autumnalis holly, is a deciduous variant of the evergreen Ilex nuculicava. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in the coastal regions of Georgia and South Carolina. The plant features small, spiny leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall before dropping. Its small, dark blue berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. The autumnalis holly is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
